question: Since what year have Penguins home games been at PPG Paints Arena?
answer: Since 2010, Penguins home games have been at PPG Paints Arena.

contexts.text: pre-season game on September 22, 2010, with a 5–1 win over the rival [Detroit Red Wings](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Detroit_Red_Wings "Detroit Red Wings"). Penguins [forward](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Forward_(ice_hockey) "Forward (ice hockey)") [Mike Comrie](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mike_Comrie "Mike Comrie") scored the first goal in the new arena, 81 seconds into the game.[\[50\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PPG_Paints_Arena#cite_note-Penguins_Open_Consol_Energy_Center_With_5%E2%80%931_Exhibition_Win-50) The team also added a third home pre-season game to the schedule. Team President David Morehouse said, "Our feeling is that more fans will want the chance to see and experience Consol Energy Center, so we thought it made sense to add the third preseason home game."[\[51\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PPG_Paints_Arena#cite_note-Pens_to_Open_New_Arena_With_Preseason_Game_vs._Detroit-51) [![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/70/Consol_Energy_Center--indoors.jpg/250px-Consol_Energy_Center--indoors.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Consol_Energy_Center--indoors.jpg) Inside PPG Paints Arena during a Penguins pre-season game in 2010. The Penguins officially opened the building on October 7, 2010, against their [cross-state rivals](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flyers%E2%80%93Penguins_rivalry "Flyers–Penguins rivalry") [Philadelphia Flyers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Philadelphia_Flyers "Philadelphia Flyers"), with the Penguins falling 3–2. The first goal was scored by the Flyers forward [Daniel Brière](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Daniel_Bri%C3%A8re "Daniel Brière") at 2:51 in the 2nd period, a [power play](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Power_play_(sport) "Power play (sport)") goal. The first Penguin goal was scored by forward [Tyler Kennedy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tyler_Kennedy "Tyler Kennedy") 44 seconds into the third period. The stars of the game were awarded to Kennedy, [Claude Giroux](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Claude_Giroux "Claude Giroux") and Flyers rookie goaltender [Sergei Bobrovsky](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sergei_Bobrovsky "Sergei Bobrovsky"), who made 29 of 31 saves in his NHL debut.[\[52\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PPG_Paints_Arena#cite_note-Flyers_spoil_Penguins'_Debut_in_New_Home_With_3%E2%80%932_Win-52) The Penguins earned their first win at the arena on October 15, 2010, against the [New York Islanders](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_York_Islanders "New York Islanders"), prevailing on an overtime power-play goal by defenseman [Alex Goligoski](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alex_Goligoski "Alex Goligoski"). It was also the first overtime game at the new arena. Goaltender [Brent Johnson](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brent_Johnson "Brent Johnson") earned the win for the Penguins, making 22 saves.[\[53\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PPG_Paints_Arena#cite_note-Penguins_3,_Islanders_2-53) The first playoff game in PPG Paints Arena was against the [Tampa Bay Lightning](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tampa_Bay_Lightning "Tampa Bay Lightning") on April 13, 2011. The first playoff goal in the building was scored by [Alexei Kovalev](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alexei_Kovalev "Alexei Kovalev"). The Penguins would go on to win the first playoff game by a score of 3–0. [Marc-André Fleury](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marc-Andr%C3%A9_Fleury "Marc-André Fleury") had a 32-save shutout. The Penguins would go on to lose in seven games.[\[54\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PPG_Paints_Arena#cite_note-nhl-54) During the 2011 off-season, 300 seats were added, increasing the hockey [seating capacity](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Seating_capacity "Seating capacity") from 18,087 to 18,387.[\[55\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PPG_Paints_Arena#cite_note-add_seats-55) PPG Paints Arena hosted its first Stanley Cup Finals in [2016](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2016_Stanley_Cup_Finals "2016 Stanley Cup Finals"), which saw the Penguins defeat the [San Jose Sharks](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/San_Jose_Sharks "San Jose Sharks") in six games to clinch its fourth Cup. Although the Penguins clinched the Cup at the [SAP Center](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SAP_Center "SAP Center") (home of the Sharks), PPG Paints did host a watch party for what turned out to be the series-clinching game, charging $10 for admission with all proceeds going to the Pittsburgh Penguins Foundation. Concessions and the team store were open, and the arena's goal horn played after every Penguins goal just like at a regular home game.[\[56\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PPG_Paints_Arena#cite_note-56) The arena hosted a similar watch party [the following year](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2017_Stanley_Cup_Finals "2017 Stanley Cup Finals") for game six while the Penguins played the [Nashville Predators](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nashville_Predators "Nashville Predators") at [Bridgestone Arena](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bridgestone_Arena "Bridgestone Arena"), which like the year before turned out to be the series-clinching game for the Penguins' fifth Cup.[\[57\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PPG_Paints_Arena#cite_note-57) [![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/fb/Consol_Energy_Center_Panoramic2.jpg/960px-Consol_Energy_Center_Panoramic2.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Consol_Energy_Center_Panoramic2.jpg "Panorama view of the lower bowl of PPG Paints Arena before the first

clinched the Cup at the [SAP Center](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SAP_Center "SAP Center") (home of the Sharks), PPG Paints did host a watch party for what turned out to be the series-clinching game, charging $10 for admission with all proceeds going to the Pittsburgh Penguins Foundation. Concessions and the team store were open, and the arena's goal horn played after every Penguins goal just like at a regular home game.[\[56\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PPG_Paints_Arena#cite_note-56) The arena hosted a similar watch party [the following year](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2017_Stanley_Cup_Finals "2017 Stanley Cup Finals") for game six while the Penguins played the [Nashville Predators](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nashville_Predators "Nashville Predators") at [Bridgestone Arena](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bridgestone_Arena "Bridgestone Arena"), which like the year before turned out to be the series-clinching game for the Penguins' fifth Cup.[\[57\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PPG_Paints_Arena#cite_note-57) [![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/fb/Consol_Energy_Center_Panoramic2.jpg/960px-Consol_Energy_Center_Panoramic2.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Consol_Energy_Center_Panoramic2.jpg "Panorama view of the lower bowl of PPG Paints Arena before the first playoff game at the arena in 2011.") [File:Consol Energy Center Panoramic2.jpg](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Consol_Energy_Center_Panoramic2.jpg "File:Consol Energy Center Panoramic2.jpg") Panorama view of the lower bowl of PPG Paints Arena before the first playoff game at the arena in 2011. [![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/5a/PPG_Paints_Arena_Scoreboard.jpg/250px-PPG_Paints_Arena_Scoreboard.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:PPG_Paints_Arena_Scoreboard.jpg) The scoreboard of PPG Paints Arena in Pittsburgh, PA during a Penguins vs. Rangers game in 2019. ### Collegiate On July 13, 2010, the arena was selected to host the [2013 NCAA Frozen Four](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NCAA_Men%27s_Ice_Hockey_Championship "NCAA Men's Ice Hockey Championship"), scheduled for April 11 and 13, 2013. The Penguins along with [Robert Morris University](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_Morris_Colonials_men%27s_ice_hockey "Robert Morris Colonials men's ice hockey") hosted the first NCAA Division I Men's Ice Hockey championship held in the state of [Pennsylvania](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pennsylvania "Pennsylvania"); the event also marked the first time that an NCAA championship game in a major team sport had been held in the city of Pittsburgh. "We are absolutely thrilled to have been chosen to host the 2013 Frozen Four at the (Consol Energy Center)," RMU head men's ice hockey coach [Derek Schooley](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Derek_Schooley "Derek Schooley") said. "The Frozen Four will be a major showcase for the city of Pittsburgh as well as our emerging hockey program. This is one of the NCAA's premier events, and Robert Morris and the city of Pittsburgh will be an excellent host."[\[58\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PPG_Paints_Arena#cite_note-NCAA_Awards_Frozen_Four_to_Pittsburgh_in_2013-58) In December 2012, the arena began hosting the [Three Rivers Classic](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Three_Rivers_Classic "Three Rivers Classic"), a two-day [Division I](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NCAA_Division_I "NCAA Division I") college ice hockey tournament. The inaugural tournament took place on December 28–29, 2012 and featured teams from [Penn State](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Penn_State_Nittany_Lions_men%27s_ice_hockey "Penn State Nittany Lions men's ice hockey"), Robert Morris, [Ohio State](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ohio_State_Buckeyes_men%27s_ice_hockey "Ohio State Buckeyes men's ice hockey") and [Miami (Ohio)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Miami_RedHawks_men%27s_ice_hockey "Miami RedHawks men's ice hockey"). Robert Morris won the first Classic title in a 1–0 win over Miami. The 2013 Classic featured Robert Morris and Penn State as the permanent fixtures, and also featured [Boston College](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boston_College_Eagles_men%27s_ice_hockey "Boston College Eagles men's ice hockey") and [Bowling Green University](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bowling_Green_Falcons_men%27s_ice_hockey "Bowling Green Falcons men's ice hockey"), with Boston College winning 8–2 over Penn State in the championship game. Meanwhile, teams such as [Michigan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michigan_Wolverines_men%27s_ice_hockey "Michigan Wolverines men's ice hockey") and [Minnesota](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Minnesota_Golden_Gophers_men%27s_ice_hockey "Minnesota Golden Gophers men's ice hockey") are seen as potential participants for upcoming Classics.[\[59\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PPG_Paints_Arena#cite_note-Molinari-59) The first collegiate event at PPG Paints Arena was the fifth-annual College Hockey Showcase on October 17, 2010, hosted by Robert Morris. In the event's first

[![Wesco Sustainability Initiatives](https://media.d3.nhle.com/image/private/t_ratio16_9-size30/f_auto/prd/jadtzqvn0zfznimchpbz.jpg)](https://www.wesco.com/us/en/our-company/environmental-social-and-governance/esg-report.html "Learn More ") [**Wesco Sustainability Initiatives**](https://www.wesco.com/us/en/our-company/environmental-social-and-governance/esg-report.html "Learn More ") Wesco's sustainability strategy is deeply integrated into its business operations, aiming to drive meaningful environmental, social, and governance (ESG) progress. Wesco has set ambitious 2030 goals, including significant reductions in greenhouse gas emissions, waste diversion from landfills, and workplace safety incidents. Their initiatives span renewable energy projects that potentially avoided more than 53,600 metric tons of CO2 emissions, enhanced fleet efficiency, and contributions to global community causes. Through strong governance, emphasizing diversity and ethics, and fostering employee growth and social impact, Wesco demonstrates a commitment to building a sustainable and inclusive future. Click below to learn more in the latest sustainability report. - [Learn More](https://www.wesco.com/us/en/our-company/environmental-social-and-governance/esg-report.html "Learn More ") ## Score for the Trees The Pittsburgh Penguins and The Davey Tree Expert Company have partnered to plant trees in the greater Pittsburgh area! Every goal scored by a Penguin on home ice adds a number to the tree counter. The two organizations will work with Tree Pittsburgh to plant the total number of trees in or around the city to help restore the urban forest in Pittsburgh. We have planted 273 trees thanks to all of the Penguins home goals scored in the 2022.23 and 2023.24 seasons! "This partnership with the Penguins is exciting because it's making Pittsburgh a greener space for the residents, businesses, and overall community, which is proven to have tremendous health and economic benefits," said Sandra Reid, vice president of corporate communications and strategic planning at Davey Tree. "Cities across the country need to expand and reestablish their urban forests, so it's great to be included in Pittsburgh's mission to do so, and Davey is thrilled to be a part of the process." - [Learn More](https://media.d3.nhle.com/image/private/t_q-best/prd/cbmdioz69oywyl4pd2tq "") ## Household Hazardous Waste Chemical Collection For the past 4 years, PPG has partnered with the Pennsylvania Resource Council (PRC) to host an annual Household Hazardous Waste Chemical collection. These events have provided over 1,400 Penguins fans and community members with an opportunity to safely discard any household chemicals such as paints, cleaners, and pesticides throughout the years. Together, PPG, the Penguins, and PRC have been able to help safely dispose of 160,000 pounds of chemical waste, keeping the materials out of homes and garages, while diverting them from our soil, air, and water. ## Making a Home for Bald Eagles A pair of bald eagles, named "Stella" and "Claire" (after U. S. Steel's Clairton plant) have been thriving on property at U. S. Steel's Mon Valley Works Irvin Plant in West Mifflin, PA. U. S. Steel shares the beauty of these majestic birds with the community through the installation of live cameras. This is believed to be the first such camera at a steel plant and only the third camera of its kind in Pennsylvania. Click below to watch a live webcam of U. S. question: During Oct 9–Dec 31, 2025, which program’s events might local rinks host several times per season?
answer: Based on the provided context, during Oct 9–Dec 31, 2025, local rinks might host several "Try Hockey for Free" events per season. The context mentions that many local rinks and youth hockey associations host these events several times throughout the season.

contexts.text: ## Off-Ice The basic skills of hockey can be learned off the ice in ball, street or dek hockey. For a full list of local dek and ball hockey rinks, [click here](https://www.nhl.com/penguins/community/dek-hockey-rinks). ## On-Ice - Learn to Skate (all ages): Introduction to ice skating taught by experienced coaches in local rinks. Utilized as the first step towards a player's ice hockey journey. The local ice rinks run Learn to Skate programs, so you can either reach out directly to the rink for program information or [use this sea](https://www.learntoskateusa.com/findaskatingprogram/) [rch tool](https://www.learntoskateusa.com/findaskatingprogram/). - Try Hockey for Free is a great place to give the sport a try! Many local rinks and youth hockey associations host these events several times throughout the season! Check with the local rink for upcoming events. More information can be [found here](https://www.nhl.com/penguins/community/try-hockey-for-free). - Learn to Play (Ages 5-9): Once your child has learned ice skating basics, the Little Penguins Learn to Play Hockey program is next. This introductory program provides first-time participants head-to-toe equipment, eight to ten on-ice sessions of age appropriate instruction, and certified coaching in a fun and safe atmosphere for a minimal cost. More information can be [found here](https://www.nhl.com/penguins/community/learn-to-play). - At the conclusion of Little Penguins Learn to Play, players are transitioned into rink or youth hockey association run development programming to ensure proper skill development that sets players on the proper path to recreational and travel leagues. The Pittsburgh Penguins and Pittsburgh Penguins Foundation are committed to growing the game of hockey for everyone. Did you know that... - Girls drop out sooner, and in greater numbers, than boys in youth sports? In fact, by the age of 14, girls quit sports at two times the rate of boys. - 73% of girls have concerns about their body while they are playing a sport. These issues should be addressed, and our goal is to provide you with some resources that may help yourself or a young woman that you know. ## **Beginning Hockey Programs** ## Intermediate Hockey Programs ### Recreational/House Leagues - Local rinks offer players the chance to practice and play games with a team in a fun but structured environment to further develop skills. ### **Travel Hockey** The Pittsburgh Amateur Hockey League (PAHL) includes 28-member youth hockey associations in Western PA, northern West Virginia and eastern Ohio. Youth hockey associations offer age-specific teams, beginning at 8 & under and continuing from 10 & under through 18 & under at various competitive levels. These organizations field youth and all-girls teams in each age categories. A full list of these 28 youth hockey associations can be found on the PAHL website [here](https://www.pahockey.com/members). ### **High School** The [Pennsylvania Interscholastic Hockey League](https://www.pihlhockey.com/) (PIHL) offers competitive interscholastic hockey teams across several divisions. A full list of Member Schools can be [found here](https://www.pihlhockey.com/members). Beginning in spring 2022, a regional girls division was formed, more information can be [found here](https://www.pihlhockey.com/page/show/7286535-girls-2022-2023-spring-girls-). ## Advanced Hockey Programs ### **Steel City Selects (Tier II)** The Steel City Selects is an all-female ice hockey organization offering 14U, 16U, and 19U teams that compete in an independent

## Penguins Try Hockey For Free

#### Presented by U. S. Steel

The Pittsburgh Penguins, with the support from the National Hockey League's Industry Growth Fund, provided 25 local partner rinks with 50 sets of hockey equipment! The equipment will be used by local rinks and associations to host Try Hockey For Free events throughout the year. Penguins Try Hockey For Free, presented by U. S. Steel initiative encourages children ages 4 to 9, to give the sport of ice hockey a try, with no cost or commitment.

The sport of hockey has had tremendous growth in Western Pennsylvania and initiatives such as Try Hockey For Free clinics allow even more children to get involved.

For 2025.26 season, there are two national event dates: **September 13, 2025** and **March 7, 2026**. The events list is updated frequently as events are confirmed, so please check back often.

"Foxburg Country Club") dating from 1887 calls the region home.[\[211\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pittsburgh#cite_note-221) Suburban [Oakmont Country Club](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oakmont_Country_Club "Oakmont Country Club") holds the record for most times as host for the [U.S. Open](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/U.S._Open_(golf) "U.S. Open (golf)") at nine; it has also hosted the [U.S. Women's Open](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/U.S._Women%27s_Open "U.S. Women's Open"), [PGA Championships](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PGA_Championship "PGA Championship"), and [U.S. Amateurs](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/U.S._Amateur "U.S. Amateur").[\[212\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pittsburgh#cite_note-222) Golf legends [Arnold Palmer](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arnold_Palmer "Arnold Palmer"), [Jim Furyk](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jim_Furyk "Jim Furyk"), and [Rocco Mediate](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rocco_Mediate "Rocco Mediate") learned the game and began their careers on Pittsburgh area courses.[\[213\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pittsburgh#cite_note-Jacob_Gilson-223) Suburban courses such as [Laurel Valley Golf Club](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Laurel_Valley_Golf_Club "Laurel Valley Golf Club") and the Fox Chapel Golf Club have hosted PGA Championships (1937, 1965), the [Ryder Cup](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ryder_Cup "Ryder Cup") (1975), [LPGA Championships](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/LPGA_Championship "LPGA Championship") (1957–58), [Senior Players Championships](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Senior_Players_Championship "Senior Players Championship") (2012–14), and the [Senior PGA Championship](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Senior_PGA_Championship "Senior PGA Championship") (2005). Local courses have sponsored annual major tournaments for 40 years: - [Pennsylvania Open Championship](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pennsylvania_Open_Championship "Pennsylvania Open Championship") 1920–1940 (even years) - [Dapper Dan Open](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dapper_Dan_Open "Dapper Dan Open") 1939–1949 - [Pittsburgh Open (LPGA Tour)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pittsburgh_Open_(LPGA_Tour) "Pittsburgh Open (LPGA Tour)") 1956 - [Pittsburgh Senior Classic](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pittsburgh_Senior_Classic "Pittsburgh Senior Classic") 1993–1998 - [84 Lumber Classic](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/84_Lumber_Classic "84 Lumber Classic") 2001–2006 - [Mylan Classic](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mylan_Classic "Mylan Classic") 2010–2013 ### Professional wrestling \[ [edit](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Pittsburgh&action=edit&section=35 "Edit section: Professional wrestling")\] Many notable [professional wrestlers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Professional_wrestling "Professional wrestling") and promoters have hailed from the city or started their careers in Pittsburgh, including [Bruno Sammartino](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bruno_Sammartino "Bruno Sammartino"), [Kurt Angle](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kurt_Angle "Kurt Angle"), [Shane Douglas](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shane_Douglas "Shane Douglas"), [Corey Graves](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Corey_Graves "Corey Graves"), [Dominic DeNucci](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dominic_DeNucci "Dominic DeNucci"), [Elias](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elias_Samson "Elias Samson"), [Britt Baker](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Britt_Baker "Britt Baker") and many more. The [Fineview](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fineview_(Pittsburgh) "Fineview (Pittsburgh)") section of Pittsburgh served as the base of the televised show [Studio Wrestling](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Studio_Wrestling "Studio Wrestling") during the 1960s.[\[214\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pittsburgh#cite_note-224)[\[215\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pittsburgh#cite_note-225) The [Keystone State Wrestling Alliance](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Keystone_State_Wrestling_Alliance "Keystone State Wrestling Alliance") (KSWA) is a [professional wrestling promotion](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Professional_wrestling_promotion "Professional wrestling promotion") which was founded in Pittsburgh in 2000. It is the only promotion based in Pittsburgh. It operates in the city's [Lawrenceville neighborhood](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lawrenceville_(Pittsburgh) "Lawrenceville (Pittsburgh)"). The KSWA performs Monthly on Saturdays at its main venue on 51st Street. ### Annual sporting events \[ [edit](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Pittsburgh&action=edit&section=36 "Edit section: Annual sporting events")\] [![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/24/PVGP_2008.jpg/250px-PVGP_2008.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:PVGP_2008.jpg) [Pittsburgh Vintage Grand Prix](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pittsburgh_Vintage_Grand_Prix "Pittsburgh Vintage Grand Prix") Pittsburgh hosts several annual major sporting events initiated in the late 20th century, including the: - [Three Rivers Regatta](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Three_Rivers_Regatta "Three Rivers Regatta") (since 1977) - [Pittsburgh Vintage Grand Prix](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pittsburgh_Vintage_Grand_Prix "Pittsburgh Vintage Grand Prix") (since 1983) - [Dirty Dozen Cycle Race](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dirty_Dozen_(bicycle_competition) "Dirty Dozen (bicycle competition)") (since 1983) - [Pittsburgh Marathon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pittsburgh_Marathon "Pittsburgh Marathon") (since 1985) - [Great Race 10K](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richard_S._Caliguiri_City_of_Pittsburgh_Great_Race "Richard S. Caliguiri City of Pittsburgh Great Race") (since 1985) - [Head of the Ohio](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Head_of_the_Ohio "Head of the Ohio") Regatta (since 1987) The city's vibrant rivers have attracted annual world-title fishing competitions of the [Forrest Wood Cup](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FLW_Outdoors "FLW Outdoors") in 2009 and the [Bassmaster Classic](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bassmaster_Classic "Bassmaster Classic") in 2005. Annual events continue during the winter months at area ski resorts such as [Boyce Park](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boyce_Park "Boyce Park"), [Seven Springs](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Seven_Springs_Mountain_Resort "Seven Springs Mountain Resort"), [Hidden Valley Resort](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hidden_Valley_Resort_(Pennsylvania) "Hidden Valley Resort (Pennsylvania)"), [Laurel Mountain](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Laurel_Mountain_Ski_Resort "Laurel Mountain Ski Resort"), and [Wisp](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wisp_Ski_Resort "Wisp Ski Resort"). Ice skating rinks are enjoyed at [PPG Place](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PPG_Place#Sites "PPG Place") and [North Park](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/North_Park_(Pittsburgh) "North Park (Pittsburgh)"). ## Government

Novak was on crutches for the first part of the offseason before returning to skating, training, and taking care of his new dog. “Me and my girlfriend got a new puppy,” Novak said with a smile. “His name is Manny. He’s a Golden Retriever puppy, he’s four and a half months now. Taking care of him, got him in July. So yeah, that was the big thing this summer, for sure.” Going into the final game of the preseason, Novak had picked up a goal and an assist in three appearances. While he feels okay, there is still work to do. “I think I'm just getting my legs under me every game a little bit more,” Novak said. “I think it can be hard, just haven’t played hockey in quite a while with the injury last year. So, I think it's getting better every game. I'm trying to just put a full 60 together. And yeah, I think there's been progress. So, I think it's on the uptrend.” His mindset for this season overall is continuing to work on his overall game, carve out a role and keep pushing forward. “I have had stretches in this league where I’ve been really good and maybe had some stretches where it’s not gone my way,” Novak said. “But I’ll just try to stay consistent every day and try to carve out a role where they can rely on me and I can be here for a while.” ### Youth Movement Shapes Penguins’ Roster Decisions Oct 04, 2025 ### Musings: Penguins 5, Sabres 4 OT (Preseason Finale) Oct 03, 2025 ### Penguins Preseason Lineup Versus Sabres (10.03.25) Oct 02, 2025 ### Penguins Trim Training Camp Roster Oct 02, 2025 ### Musings: Penguins 5, Sabres 3 (Preseason Game 6) Oct 01, 2025 ### Penguins Preseason Lineup Versus Sabres (10.01.25) Sep 30, 2025 ### Assistant Coach Spotlight: Rich Clune Sep 30, 2025 ### Building Brick by Brick: Kindel Earning Opportunities Sep 29, 2025 ### Penguins, F.N.B. question: When booking by phone, what should diners mention for Restaurant Week?
answer: When booking by phone, diners should mention Pittsburgh Restaurant Week.

contexts.text:
Excited to celebrate Pittsburgh Restaurant Week?  Here are some tips to ensure you get the most out of your restaurant week experience.

- Make reservations early, many of the most popular restaurants get booked up. If making a reservation by phone, be sure to mention Pittsburgh Restaurant Week when booking **.**
- Read menus and reviews of participating restaurants. Restaurant Week is a great opportunity to experience the diverse restaurants available in Pittsburgh. Some restaurants offer pre-fixed menus as their restaurant week special, others offer a flat discount.
- Be aware that not all restaurants participating in Pittsburgh Restaurant Week offer the promotional menu at lunch AND dinner. When you make your reservation, you should confirm with the restaurant that they are participating in Restaurant Week. Some restaurants may have seats set aside for diners participating in the celebration.

_Ever attended a restaurant week before, in Pittsburgh or elsewhere?  Share your experiences and tell everyone about it by commenting below._

Categories: [Pittsburgh Restaurant Week 2012](https://pittsburghrestaurantweek.com/category/pittsburgh-restaurant-week-2012/)[Subfeature](https://pittsburghrestaurantweek.com/category/subfeature/)

## [Tips for Pittsburgh Restaurant Week](https://pittsburghrestaurantweek.com/general/tips-for-pittsburgh-restaurant-week/ "Tips for Pittsburgh Restaurant Week")

Excited to celebrate Pittsburgh Restaurant Week?  Here are some tips to ensure you get the most out of your restaurant week experience. Make reservations early, many of the most popular restaurants get booked up. If making a reservation by phone, be sure to mention Pittsburgh Restaurant Week when booking. contexts.text: # Frequently Asked Questions ## How can I join or renew my History Center membership? There are several ways you can purchase or renew your membership: - In person at our Admissions Desk or Museum Shop - [Online](https://www.heinzhistorycenter.org/join "Join") - By mail at: Membership, Senator John Heinz History Center, 1212 Smallman Street, Pittsburgh, PA 15222 - Call us at 412-454-6436 ## What does my membership include? Information about specific membership levels and benefits can be located [here](https://www.heinzhistorycenter.org/join/ "Membership Types"). ## How long does my History Center membership last? Memberships benefits begin immediately and last through the end of the month of purchase the following year. ## How long does it take to receive my History Center membership packet? Membership fulfillment usually takes 10-15 business days. If you do not receive your History Center membership packet within this timeframe, please let us know and we will be happy to assist you. ## Can I upgrade my History Center membership to a higher level? You can always upgrade your membership to meet your needs. Please contact us at 412-454-6351 or [membership@heinzhistorycenter.org](mailto:membership@heinzhistorycenter.org). ## Can I visit other museums with my History Center membership? Yes! Your History Center membership also includes free, unlimited admission to the [Western Pennsylvania Sports Museum](https://www.heinzhistorycenter.org/sports), [Fort Pitt Museum,](https://www.heinzhistorycenter.org/fort-pitt) and [Meadowcroft Rockshelter and Historic Village](https://www.heinzhistorycenter.org/meadowcroft). The Senator John Heinz History Center is also a [Smithsonian Institution Affiliate](http://affiliations.si.edu/) which means that a Smithsonian membership is included with your History Center membership. This benefit entitles you to a year’s subscription to _Smithsonian_ magazine, discounts at Smithsonian shops and select dining facilities, and free admission to the Cooper-Hewitt, National Design Museum in New York City (other Smithsonian museums are free for everyone). ## I am a Smithsonian Institution member. Do I receive free or discounted admission to the History Center? Not currently, but you can receive free admission by becoming a History Center member. All History Center members receive a Smithsonian membership, as well, with access to the benefits described in the question above. For more information on our Smithsonian Institution partnership and a directory of Affiliate institutions, please visit [affiliations.si.edu](https://affiliations.si.edu/) ## Can I use my membership for a group tour, field trip, or 21+ nights? Free membership admission does not apply to group visits or special programs such as 21+ nights due to additional programming and expenses related to these visits. [All K-12 student groups can visit the museum for field trips free of charge](https://www.heinzhistorycenter.org/learn/education/history-center-field-trips/). ## Is my contact or financial information shared with other organizations or vendors? Please refer to our [Privacy Statement](https://www.heinzhistorycenter.org/policies/ "Financial & Privacy Information") “Disclosure of Personal Information” section. ## Is it safe to use my credit card to purchase a membership on your e-store? The Senator John Heinz History Center contracts with professional payment processing software services that utilize modern software security and encryption technologies to process all transactions. These software providers are required to complete regular compliance certifications to attest to the use of best practices for credit card processing. ## Is my History Center membership tax-deductible? A portion of your membership is not tax-deductible because of the

- MOBILE TICKET BARCODE #### What is a Mobile Ticket Barcode? Each ticket has a mobile ticket barcode that must be scanned for entry into PNC Park via your mobile device. Within the Wallet, you can tap on an individual ticket to view its barcode. For entry to PNC Park, present your mobile device with the mobile barcode open and available to scan. #### How do I access the ticket to scan for entry? Tap on an individual ticket from the Tickets tab’s Wallet to pull up the mobile ticket barcode. The Section/Row/Seat and barcode will be displayed along with access to the terms and conditions governing your ticket. #### Why is my ticket barcode not showing in the MLB Ballpark app? There are several reasons why your barcode may not be available including that the ticket has been forwarded, the ticket had been forwarded to you and has since been canceled or recalled, or you are a group or suite buyer and the ticket status has changed. For mailed tickets, the ticket barcode will not appear until those tickets have been printed and mailed to you. For further assistance, contact Pirates Fans Services at [ticketservices@pirates.com](mailto:ticketservices@pirates.com) or 1-800-BUY-BUCS. #### I just forwarded a ticket via the MLB Ballpark app. Why do I still see it? Your ticket, without the barcode, will remain in your Tickets tab’s Wallet until your forward is accepted by the recipient. If you wish to cancel the forward, you can do that directly from the ticket. #### During what window of time can I forward tickets to friends? You can forward tickets via the MLB Ballpark app from the moment you purchase them until two hours after the first pitch of that day's game as long as that ticket has not already been scanned in for entry at PNC Park. #### What should I do if I need to enter PNC Park for the start of the game and the rest of my group is not here yet? You can easily forward tickets to friends via the MLB Ballpark app up to two hours after the start of that day's game as long as the tickets have not already been scanned in for entry at PNC Park. #### Can I use Apple Wallet for my Pirates tickets? Yes. From the bottom of the ticket inside the MLB Ballpark app you can tap the "Add to Wallet" button to add your ticket to Apple Wallet. #### Can I use Google Pay for my Pirates tickets? No. Support for adding tickets to Google Pay is not yet available from the MLB Ballpark app. #### Why won't my ticket barcode scan? If your screen brightness is too low, the barcode may have difficulty being scanned. The MLB Ballpark app will automatically attempt to increase the brightness of your display or you can do so manually by following the instructions for your device. Please note, cracked screens may impact your barcode's ability to scan. The barcode displayed is accompanied by a number. If there are difficulties reading a valid barcode on a

verified the email address associated with your MLB account, the MLB Ballpark app will recognize that and you will not be asked to verify again. #### How do I find tickets that I purchased with another one of my email addresses? You can find tickets that you purchased with another of your email addresses by tapping the Profile icon in the top left hand corner of the Home Tab, tapping My MLB Account Emails, and entering the email address associated with your ticket purchase in the Add Another Email field. An email will be sent to the email address. You will be required to verify that you want to associate it with the MLB account that you’re logged in to MLB Ballpark with. After verifying the association you will be able to access and manage all tickets associated with your secondary email address. #### My email address is verified, I see a ticket account number in the Ticket Accounts page. Why aren't my tickets showing up in the MLB Ballpark app? After you've confirmed that the tickets were purchased with an email address that is verified on the My MLB Account Emails page (accessible by tapping the Profile icon in the top left hand corner of the Home Tab and then tapping My MLB Account Emails) and that your Pirates ticket account is displaying on the Ticket Accounts page, you may need to refresh your Tickets tab’s Wallet by pulling down on the screen to see updated ticket inventory. [arrow-up-4\\ Back to Top](https://www.mlb.com/pirates/tickets/mobile/faqs#top) ### MLB BALLPARK APP - TICKET WALLET #### What is the Ticket Wallet? The Ticket Tab’s Wallet provides you with quick access and management of all of your MLB tickets. After downloading the MLB Ballpark app, click the Tickets icon on the bottom tab to see all of the tickets you own. #### Can I see all my tickets for all teams within the Wallet, or just one team at a time? You will be able to access your tickets to any MLB team's game or event as long as you used the same MLB account or email address to purchase the tickets. #### Where can I see more event details about the game? In the team page accessed via the bottom tab bar, you can find detailed information about the day's event. #### What if I cannot find tickets I purchased or tickets that were forwarded to me? First confirm that the tickets were purchased with an email address that is verified on the My MLB Account Emails page which is accessible by tapping the Profile icon in the top left hand corner of the Home Tab and then tapping My MLB Account Emails. Next, confirm that a Pirates ticket account is displaying on the My Ticket Accounts page. If there is not a Pirates ticket account listed, and you’re certain that the email address you have verified in MLB Account is correct then please contact Pirates Fans Services at [ticketservices@pirates.com](mailto:ticketservices@pirates.com) or 1-800-BUY-BUCS. [![](https://www.picklesburgh.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/06/pickleriding-nobackdrop2.png)](https://www.picklesburgh.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/06/pickleriding-nobackdrop2.png)

# Giddy Up, Gherkin!

##### This jarring twist on the classic mechanical bull is a test of dill-termination and skill! Climb aboard the giant gherkin and try to hang on as it bucks, spins, and wiggles with unpredictable pickle power.

[![](https://www.picklesburgh.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/07/IMG_4622-scaled.jpg)](https://www.picklesburgh.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/07/IMG_4622-scaled.jpg)

## Where is it?

#### **Fourth Avenue by** **PPG Plaza**

The mechanical pickle will operate during festival hours near PPG Plaza

## How much does it cost?

#### **$12 per ride**

Tickets can be purchased onsite – no reservations needed

## Who can ride?

#### **Riders must be 18+**

All ages are welcome to watch the action! Riders must sign a waiver upon ticket purchase.

Presented by

[![](https://www.picklesburgh.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/06/Pella_Dot_W-D_Stacked-1-1024x462.png)](https://www.picklesburgh.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/06/Pella_Dot_W-D_Stacked-1.png)

* * *

## **About Picklesburgh**

Picklesburgh is the destination for all things pickled! Voted the #1 Specialty Food Festival in the Country four times by the readers of USA Today, Picklesburgh goes beyond the dill pickle to feature handcrafted food and artisan drinks featuring pickled ingredients from local chefs, restaurants, and more. Plus, don’t miss pickle-themed snacks and merchandise, fun contests, and entertainment set to the backdrop of picturesque Downtown Pittsburgh.

[**Plan Your visit**](https://www.picklesburgh.com/visit/)

[Emily Richter a Grand Finals Winner of Metropolitan Opera’s Laffont Competition](https://pittsburghopera.org/current-media-releases/emily-richter-a-grand-finals-winner-of-metropolitan-operas-laffont-competition) Close ### No Events ## EVENTS ‹ ##### October 2025 › Today Jump To:  ## GLORY DENIED Tom Cipullo • February 23, 26, March 1, 3, 2019 Based on a book by Tom Philpott, **Glory Denied** tells the true story of Colonel Jim Thompson, America’s longest-held prisoner of war. The opera deals not only with Thompson’s suffering in the jungle of southeast Asia during the Vietnam War, but also the tragic aftermath that followed his liberation. Colonel Thompson endured his brutal captivity by doggedly clinging to memories of his loving wife Alyce and their children. Alyce, however, believed Jim was dead. She and her children moved to Massachusetts with another man, leading to a painful reunion after Jim’s release. **Glory Denied** is, above all, the story of an American family during one our nation’s most turbulent eras. In its review of Mr. Philpott’s book, The New York Times stated: _Indeed it is not too much to say that **Glory Denied** and Colonel Thompson’s mixed feelings about it encapsulate something of the moral essence of the Vietnam War and the imperishable bitterness of its legacy._ **Glory Denied** will star Pittsburgh Opera’s Resident Artists, and be performed in the intimate environs of Pittsburgh Opera Headquarters. Limited capacity - order now! " _Glory Denied as a whole is in keeping with Pittsburgh Opera’s past record of presenting contemporary works by gifted and impressive Resident Artists. The company deserves praise for consistently offering opportunities to hear rarities delivered by strong, young talent, and patronage is the only reward commensurate with its efforts...the work deserves full houses for all._" - [Pittsburgh in the Round](https://www.pghintheround.com/pittsburgh-operas-premiere-of-glory-denied/) Older Thompson (Benjamin Taylor), Older Alyce (Caitlin Gotimer), Younger Alyce (Ashley Fabian) and Younger Thompson (Terrence Chin-Loy). [Emily Richter a Grand Finals Winner of Metropolitan Opera’s Laffont Competition](https://pittsburghopera.org/current-media-releases/emily-richter-a-grand-finals-winner-of-metropolitan-operas-laffont-competition) Close ### No Events ## EVENTS ‹ ##### October 2025 › Today Jump To:  ## TIME TO ACT Music by Laura Kaminsky Libretto by Crystal Manich • FEBRUARY 28, MARCH 3, 6, 8, 2026 [BUY TICKETS](https://opera.culturaldistrict.org/production/99487/time-to-act) Build the world you want to see. A group of high school students prepares for a production of Sophocles’ _Antigone_, joined by a new student, Alona, who comes with a formidable secret. Pittsburgh Opera is proud to present this gripping world premiere. Time to Act demonstrates how the arts can uplift and unify victims of trauma, empowering them to act, while giving voice to the young citizens who have been most impacted by an ongoing cycle of devastating school violence. Time to Act is composed by [Laura Kaminsky](https://laurakaminsky.com/), whose acclaimed opera _As One_ has become the most-produced modern opera in America. Emmy Award nominee [Crystal Manich](https://www.crystalmanich.com/), the librettist, is a Pittsburgh Opera mainstay whose works for stage, film, and circus have been seen across the United States, Europe, Argentina, and Australia. _Content warning: this opera contains a simulated safety drill, and discussions related to the topics of school shootings, school violence, and PTSD._ **Time to Act** _is a Co-Commission by Pittsburgh Opera, Opera Montana and Boston Conservatory at Berklee, with additional funding by Opera Santa Barbara._ Michael Sakir conducts; [Crystal Manich](https://www.crystalmanich.com/) directs. Where: Bitz Opera Factory, Strip District When: - Saturday, February 28, 2026 \* 7:00 PM - Tuesday, March 3, 2026 \* 7:00 PM - Friday, March 6, 2026 \* 7:00 PM - Sunday, March 8, 2026 \* 2:00 PM Alona, the new girl: [Timothi Williams](https://www.timothiwilliams.com/) + Tyson, an injured football player: [Erik Nordstrom](https://pittsburghopera.org/resident-artists/2024-25resident-artists/erik-nordstrom?hsLang=en)\* Bailey, a responsible and sweet spirit: [Shannon Crowley](https://pittsburghopera.org/resident-artists/2024-25resident-artists/shannon-crowley?hsLang=en)\* José, an actor: [Logan Wagner](https://pittsburghopera.org/resident-artists/2024-25resident-artists/logan-wagner?hsLang=en)\* Robin Grace, the drama teacher : [Yazid Gray](https://www.yazidgray.com/)\*\* Conductor: [Michael Sakir](http://www.michaelsakir.com/) + Stage Director : [Crystal Manich](https://www.crystalmanich.com/) Dramaturgical assistance by [Amy Hutchison](https://www.amyhutchison.com/) Scenic & Costume Designer: Lindsay Fuori Lighting Designer: Mary Ellen Stebbins Sound Designer: Pan-Pan Gou Assistant Conductor: [Glenn Lewis](https://www.pittsburghopera.org/resident-artists/faculty-administration/glenn-lewis-head-of-music/?hsLang=en) Chorus Master: [Mark Trawka](https://www.pittsburghopera.org/resident-artists/faculty-administration/mark-trawka-director-of-musical-studies-and-chorus-master/?hsLang=en) Associate Coach/Pianist: [James Lesniak](https://www.pittsburghopera.org/resident-artists/faculty-administration/james-lesniak-associate-coach-pianist/?hsLang=en) Assistant Stage Director: [Dana Kinney](https://pittsburghopera.org/resident-artists/2024-25resident-artists/dana-kinney?hsLang=en)\* Stage Manager: Tess Naval + Pittsburgh Opera debut \* Pittsburgh Opera Resident Artist \*\* Pittsburgh Opera Resident Artist

question: As reported on Oct 2, 2025, where did the Steelers face the Vikings in their 24-21 win?
answer: The Steelers faced the Vikings in Dublin, Ireland, for their 24-21 win.

# Next men up Oct 02, 2025 at 07:00 AM [Mike Prisuta](https://www.steelers.com/author/mike-prisuta) Steelers.com [Opens Twitter profile page in new window - Opens new window](https://twitter.com/DVEMike) - Copied! When they deactivated running back Jaylen Warren in advance of last Sunday's meeting with the Vikings in Dublin, the Steelers knew they'd have to replace their leading rusher and leading receiver through the season's first three weeks. They also knew what they had in running back Kenneth Gainwell. With Warren and his 132 rushing yards and 142 receiving yards sidelined due to a knee injury, Gainwell responded with a career day in the Steelers' 24-21 victory. Gainwell's 19 carries constituted a career-high total, as did his 99 rushing yards and two rushing touchdowns. His 5.2-yard average per carry was the second-highest he'd achieved in a game in which he'd been asked to carry the ball at least 10 times. Gainwell also had six catches on six targets for 35 receiving yards. His signature series in the estimation of running backs coach Eddie Faulkner was the five-play, 35-yard drive that produced a touchdown and a 21-6 Steelers' lead with 2:23 left in the third quarter. The possession commenced after an interception and 13-yard return by outside linebacker T.J. Watt. Quarterback Aaron Rodgers hit tight end Darnell Washington for 8 yards to start the march. After that, Gainwell carried for gains of 7, 6, 10 and 4 yards on the way to the end zone. "You know, that drive, we went down and scored after T.J.'s interception, (Gainwell) was doing a really good job of controlling the game," Faulkner said. "You saw some patience come out on him. Whether it was gap-scheme or zone-scheme he was being patient, letting the blocks develop for him and then bursting through the hole. "That was a really good series to see where he kind of took the game over. But Kenny's a vet, professional, and so I expect him to be able to do those things, to be honest." A bonus against Minnesota was the opportunity to get rookie running back Kaleb Johnson involved. Johnson hadn't been used in the Steelers 21-14 win on Sept. 21 at New England after failing to field a kickoff in the Steelers' 31-17 loss to the Seahawks on Sept. 14. The gaffe against Seattle was part of what has been a slow start for Johnson. But the Steelers haven't lost faith in their third-round draft pick from Iowa. Johnson carried six times for 22 yards against the Vikings, the first time he's rushed more than once in a game this season. "He has the luxury of having two really good veterans that have played a lot in front of him who are selfless and willing to help him in any way they can," Faulkner said, referencing Warren and Gainwell. "Obviously, (Johnson) is a great talent. There's some growth there, he knows that. We all know that and we're just going to keep working toward it because we know we're going to need him to win here down the stretch. "That was a big boost for

question: Which running back did the Steelers deactivate before their Dublin game vs. the Vikings?
answer: The Steelers deactivated running back Jaylen Warren before their Dublin game against the Vikings.

contexts.text: # Steelers in Dublin \| Pittsburgh Steelers - Steelers.com #### The Pittsburgh Steelers are making history this fall, playing in the first-ever NFL regular season game in Ireland as they face the Minnesota Vikings at Croke Park on Sunday, September 28. To celebrate this landmark moment, the Pittsburgh Steelers and Aer Lingus are bringing the Black & Gold to Ireland with a week-long set of fan events, community programming, and unforgettable experiences. From Dublin to Belfast to Newry, Steelers Nation will be on full display leading up to the team's game against the Vikings. ## Steelers in Dublin ## Gameday in Dublin ## NFL in Dublin #### NFL One Pass The NFL OnePass app is your one-stop shop for all NFL Ireland events! Whether you're headed to NFL Experience Dublin or the 2025 NFL Dublin Game, we've got you covered with event details, schedules, maps, and more! Download the app now to get started. [DOWNLOAD NOW](https://www.nfl.com/apps/one-pass/) ## On Location #### On Location Join the excitement with an official gameday package from On Location, the Official Hospitality Provider of the NFL. Limited packages that include verified tickets and access to the official Steelers pregame party are still available. Already have your tickets? You can still elevate your gameday experience with access to the Steelers pregame party which features: - Chef-curated cuisine including Irish favorites and local beverages - Live musical entertainment and appearances by NFL Legends - An electric atmosphere within walking distance of the stadium [BOOK NOW](https://onlocationexp.com/nfl/pittsburgh-steelers-ireland?utm_source=steelers.com&utm_medium=referral&utm_campaign=isg_ireland_teams-steelers_ireland_informational_page_content_block) ## Gameday Poster #### Week 4: Steelers vs. Vikings **Bio:** Shelby Kirk has been working in Pittsburgh as a designer and illustrator for Bootstrap Design Company for six years. This has allowed her to do illustration work for many beloved Pittsburgh brands such as La Prima Espresso Co., Slice on Broadway, CMU School of Computer Science, Leona's, and Shorty's Pins x Pints. Professional design work challenges her to develop a wide array of styles tailored to the unique voice of each individual client. This project was an exciting opportunity to tap into her own personal style and express her love for the city she calls home. In any and all of her free time, she loves to run, bike and hike with her 2 pups and her fiancé. \[ [edit](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Carnegie_Mellon_University&action=edit&section=8 "Edit section: IDeATe")\] [![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0f/Entertainment_Technology_Center%2C_Carnegie_Mellon_University.jpg/250px-Entertainment_Technology_Center%2C_Carnegie_Mellon_University.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Entertainment_Technology_Center,_Carnegie_Mellon_University.jpg) Carnegie Mellon's [Entertainment Technology Center](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Entertainment_Technology_Center "Entertainment Technology Center") Carnegie Mellon also runs the Integrative Design, Arts, and Technology (IDeATe) Network to provide university-wide arts and technology education to students from every college. IDeATe allows students to take minors or concentrations in Animation and Special Effects, Entrepreneurship for Creative Industries, Game Design, Intelligent Environments, Learning Media, Media Design, Physical Computing, and Sound Design. IDeAte will also offer graduate master's degrees in Emerging Media, Game Design, Integrative Innovation for Products and Services, Computational Data Science, Urban Design, and Production Technology and Management. IDeATe also manages the [Entertainment Technology Center](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Entertainment_Technology_Center "Entertainment Technology Center") (ETC) in conjunction with the School of Computer Science and the College of Fine Arts. Each master's degree program has an option to study in the CMU Integrative Media Program (IMP) at [Steiner Studios](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Steiner_Studios "Steiner Studios") in [New York City](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_York_City "New York City"). IDeATe Network will be based on the Pittsburgh campus upon the development of recently acquired property on [Forbes Avenue](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Forbes_Avenue "Forbes Avenue") west of [Junction Hollow](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Junction_Hollow "Junction Hollow").[\[58\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carnegie_Mellon_University#cite_note-58) ## Academics \[ [edit](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Carnegie_Mellon_University&action=edit&section=9 "Edit section: Academics")\] ### Rankings \[ [edit](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Carnegie_Mellon_University&action=edit&section=10 "Edit section: Rankings")\] | [Academic rankings](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/College_and_university_rankings_in_the_United_States "College and university rankings in the United States") | Nationally, _[U.S. News & World Report](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/U.S._News_%26_World_Report "U.S. News & World Report")_ placed Carnegie Mellon in a tie with [Washington University in St. Louis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Washington_University_in_St._Louis "Washington University in St. Louis") and the [University of Michigan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/University_of_Michigan "University of Michigan") for 21st place among American research universities in their 2024-2025 rankings.[\[68\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carnegie_Mellon_University#cite_note-68) Many of its graduate programs have been ranked in national and international surveys. In 2022, _U.S. News_ ranked Carnegie Mellon as having 23 graduate programs in the Top 10 nationwide and 16 in the Top 5 nationwide.,[\[69\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carnegie_Mellon_University#cite_note-69) including three programs ranked first: Artificial Intelligence, Programming Languages, and Information and Technology Management. In particular, the [CMU School of Computer Science](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carnegie_Mellon_School_of_Computer_Science "Carnegie Mellon School of Computer Science") has been consistently ranked the best in the nation, tied with [MIT](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Massachusetts_Institute_of_Technology "Massachusetts Institute of Technology"), [Stanford](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stanford_University "Stanford University"), and [UC Berkeley](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/University_of_California,_Berkeley "University of California, Berkeley").[\[70\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carnegie_Mellon_University#cite_note-70) Globally, Carnegie Mellon is ranked 28th by _[Times Higher Education](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Times_Higher_Education "Times Higher Education")_ and 52nd by _[QS World University Rankings](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/QS_World_University_Rankings "QS World University Rankings")_. Carnegie Mellon was named one of the "New [Ivies](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ivy_League "Ivy League")" by _[Newsweek](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Newsweek "Newsweek")_.[\[71\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carnegie_Mellon_University#cite_note-71) In 2010, _[The Wall Street Journal](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Wall_Street_Journal "The Wall Street Journal")_ ranked Carnegie Mellon 1st in computer science, 4th in finance, 10th overall, and 21st in engineering according to job recruiters.[\[72\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carnegie_Mellon_University#cite_note-72) Carnegie Mellon ranks thirteenth among "Best Colleges By Salary Potential (Bachelor's Only)" in the United States according to _[PayScale](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PayScale "PayScale")_'s 2016–17 study.[\[73\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carnegie_Mellon_University#cite_note-73) In 2024, Carnegie Mellon's [Tepper School of Business](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tepper_School_of_Business "Tepper School of Business") placed 9th in an [annual ranking](https://www.bloomberg.com/business-schools/regions/us/) of U.S. business schools by _[Bloomberg Businessweek](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bloomberg_Businessweek "Bloomberg Businessweek")_.[\[74\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carnegie_Mellon_University#cite_note-74) In 2016, _[The Hollywood Reporter](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Hollywood_Reporter "The Hollywood Reporter")_ ranked the School of Drama 3rd in the world among undergraduate drama schools.[\[75\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carnegie_Mellon_University#cite_note-75) In 2015, the same publication ranked the MFA program at the School of Drama 5th in the world.[\[76\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carnegie_Mellon_University#cite_note-76) Carnegie Mellon's [Dietrich College of Humanities and Social Sciences](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dietrich_College_of_Humanities_and_Social_Sciences "Dietrich College of Humanities and Social Sciences")

question: Who made the 13-yard interception return that set up a Steelers touchdown drive?
answer: T.J. Watt made the 13-yard interception return that set up a Steelers touchdown drive.

contexts.text: # Next men up Oct 02, 2025 at 07:00 AM [Mike Prisuta](https://www.steelers.com/author/mike-prisuta) Steelers.com [Opens Twitter profile page in new window - Opens new window](https://twitter.com/DVEMike) - Copied! When they deactivated running back Jaylen Warren in advance of last Sunday's meeting with the Vikings in Dublin, the Steelers knew they'd have to replace their leading rusher and leading receiver through the season's first three weeks. They also knew what they had in running back Kenneth Gainwell. With Warren and his 132 rushing yards and 142 receiving yards sidelined due to a knee injury, Gainwell responded with a career day in the Steelers' 24-21 victory. Gainwell's 19 carries constituted a career-high total, as did his 99 rushing yards and two rushing touchdowns. His 5.2-yard average per carry was the second-highest he'd achieved in a game in which he'd been asked to carry the ball at least 10 times. Gainwell also had six catches on six targets for 35 receiving yards. His signature series in the estimation of running backs coach Eddie Faulkner was the five-play, 35-yard drive that produced a touchdown and a 21-6 Steelers' lead with 2:23 left in the third quarter. The possession commenced after an interception and 13-yard return by outside linebacker T.J. Watt. Quarterback Aaron Rodgers hit tight end Darnell Washington for 8 yards to start the march. After that, Gainwell carried for gains of 7, 6, 10 and 4 yards on the way to the end zone. "You know, that drive, we went down and scored after T.J.'s interception, (Gainwell) was doing a really good job of controlling the game," Faulkner said. "You saw some patience come out on him. Whether it was gap-scheme or zone-scheme he was being patient, letting the blocks develop for him and then bursting through the hole. "That was a really good series to see where he kind of took the game over. But Kenny's a vet, professional, and so I expect him to be able to do those things, to be honest." A bonus against Minnesota was the opportunity to get rookie running back Kaleb Johnson involved. Johnson hadn't been used in the Steelers 21-14 win on Sept. 21 at New England after failing to field a kickoff in the Steelers' 31-17 loss to the Seahawks on Sept. 14. The gaffe against Seattle was part of what has been a slow start for Johnson. But the Steelers haven't lost faith in their third-round draft pick from Iowa. Johnson carried six times for 22 yards against the Vikings, the first time he's rushed more than once in a game this season. "He has the luxury of having two really good veterans that have played a lot in front of him who are selfless and willing to help him in any way they can," Faulkner said, referencing Warren and Gainwell. "Obviously, (Johnson) is a great talent. There's some growth there, he knows that. We all know that and we're just going to keep working toward it because we know we're going to need him to win here down the stretch. "That was a big boost for

tackle Cam Heyward got his hands up, forcing Rodgers to double-clutch on the pass. That gave Beanie Bishop the opportunity to step underneath Garrett Wilson and intercept the pass at the Pittsburgh 46. Four plays later, Russell Wilson tossed an 11-yard TD to George Pickens, cutting New York's lead to 15-13 and starting a run of 31 consecutive points for the Steelers. Bishop also would pick off Rodgers in the third quarter to set up another touchdown. _•_ _Dale Lolley is co-host of "SNR Drive" on Steelers Nation Radio. Subscribe to the podcast here:_ [Apple Podcast](https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/snr-drive-with-matt-dale-pittsburgh-steelers/id1445185242) \| [iHeart Podcast](https://www.iheart.com/podcast/256-snr-drive-with-matt-dale-p-31132091?cmp=ios_share&sc=ios_social_share&pr=false&autoplay=true) _Week 7, 2:42 3rd quarter, against New York Jets_ With the Steelers leading 23-15, the Jets lined up for a 35-yard field goal attempt. But Greg Zuerlein's attempt was blocked by defensive lineman Dean Lowry, turning the Jets away without points. It marked the third consecutive game in which the Steelers blocked a kick, tying a team record for most blocks in consecutive games and blocks in a single season. _Week 8, 4:58 3rd quarter, against New York Giants_ The Steelers were locked in a 9-9 tie with the visiting Giants when an Alex Highsmith sack helped force New York to punt. Austin fielded the punt at his own 27 on the right hash, cut all the way back across the field, picking up a block on the edge from Rodney Williams and sprinted up the sideline for a 73-yard punt return touchdown. It was the Steelers' first punt return for a score since 2019. On the Steelers' next possession, Austin would catch a 29-yard touchdown pass from Wilson, helping the Steelers to their sixth win. _Week 8, 3:03 4th quarter, against New York Giants_ With the Steelers leading 26-18, Wilson fumbled on a scramble, with the Giants recovering at the Pittsburgh 37. But with the Giants at the 19, Watt whipped his block at the snap, hit quarterback Daniel Jones and forced him to fumble, recovering the loose ball himself. The Steelers would run the clock down to two minutes while moving out to midfield before punting. And Bishop would record his third interception in two weeks in the closing seconds to seal the win for the Steelers. ## Related Content [![](https://static.clubs.nfl.com/image/upload/t_editorial_landscape_mobile/t_lazy/f_auto/steelers/rj2x6jlmd2sgprf4yxxo.jpg)\\ \\ news\\ \\ \\ **Winning while building**\\ \\ The Steelers head into their bye week with a 3-1 record](https://www.steelers.com/news/winning-while-building "Winning while building") [![](https://static.clubs.nfl.com/image/upload/t_editorial_landscape_mobile/t_lazy/f_png/steelers/i7btzicosviyf83wurca.png)\\ \\ news\\ \\ \\ **Five Fast Facts: Brandin Echols**\\ \\ Learn more about Brandin Echols in this edition of Five Fast Facts](https://www.steelers.com/news/five-fast-facts-brandin-echols "Five Fast Facts: Brandin Echols") [![](https://static.clubs.nfl.com/image/upload/t_editorial_landscape_mobile/t_lazy/f_png/steelers/hxpq5fwt6jwfdmbzs7m5.png)\\ \\ news\\ \\ \\ **Five Fast Facts: Darius Slay**\\ \\ Learn more about Darius Slay in this edition of Five Fast Facts](https://www.steelers.com/news/five-fast-facts-darius-slay "Five Fast Facts: Darius Slay") [![](https://static.clubs.nfl.com/image/upload/t_editorial_landscape_mobile/t_lazy/f_png/steelers/gfbre5360twmbebktymu.png)\\ \\ news\\ \\ \\ **Five Fast Facts: Kaleb Johnson**\\ \\ Learn more about Kaleb Johnson in this edition of Five Fast Facts](https://www.steelers.com/news/five-fast-facts-kaleb-johnson "Five Fast Facts: Kaleb Johnson") [![](<Base64-Image-Removed>)\\ \\ news\\ \\ \\ **The voice of experience**\\ \\ Seumalo's play, presence counted upon to steady youngsters up front](https://www.steelers.com/news/the-voice-of-experience "The voice of experience") [![](<Base64-Image-Removed>)\\ \\ news\\ \\ \\ **Five Fast Facts: Malik Harrison**\\
